abstracts.cdata!:
The project would include the following:
            (i) establishment and operation of an experimental
            underground mine at the site of the phosphate deposits in
            the New Valley to determine the feasibility of producing
            during the first stage up to 3.5 million and ultimately up
            to 7 million tons of beneficiated rock per year through long
            wall and/or other mining techniques. (ii) Carrying out the
            necessary laboratory testing to verify the suitability of
            the New Valley phosphate rock to manufacture phosphoric acid
            and other phosphate fertilizer intermediates and carry out
            pilot tests for the purpose of establishing design data for
            the full scale beneficiation and phosphoric acid plants;
            (iii) undertaking further studies of the location and of the
            capital and operating costs of the full scale phosphoric
            acid plant, including the required infrastructure with
            respect to the railway and its operating procedures as well
            as the port facilities; and (iv) should experience gained
            from the operation of the experimental mine and the results
            of the various studies confirm the economic, financial and
            technical feasibility of converting New Valley phosphate
            rock into phosphoric acid or other phosphate intermediates,
            preparation of the necessary feasibility study for the first
            stage of the project.
